page.title: 05ECOLOGY 1
page.content: {GENERAL REVIEW} The landscape is largely rural with the exception of the derelict industrial North- West corner around Rosewell. Farming was improved at the beginning of the century when land-owners enclosed the fields and shelter belts were planted to improve the micro-climate of the land. These shelter belts still exist but gales have blown down many of the mature deciduous trees. Japanese Larch has commonly been used to replace them. They are faster growing and being thicker they make better wind breaks. In the deep river valleys there are natural woodlands. Dutch Elm Disease has infected many trees, so they are being removed.
